alert.note: Alert for Doddridge; Gilmer; Ritchie; Wirt; Wood (West Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 13 at 8:45AM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Ritchie, southern Doddridge, northwestern Gilmer, northeastern Wirt and east central Wood Counties through 930 AM EDT... At 845 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 8 miles west of North Bend State Park, or 10 miles northeast of Elizabeth, moving east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Harrisville, Pennsboro, North Bend State Park, Ellenboro, Cairo, Pullman, Auburn, Smithville, Newberne, Berea, Brohard, Macfarlan, Burnt House, Greenwood, Blandville, Nutter Farm, Avon, Grove, Leopold and Petroleum. This includes Route 50 in West Virginia between mile markers 20 and 48, and near mile marker 51. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
